Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the significance of the satellite images by presenting them as evidence of the Balakot air strike.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support as it relies solely on satellite images without providing additional evidence or context.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the satellite images accurately depict the aftermath of the air strike without considering other possible explanations or factors.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the changes seen in the satellite images, such as natural causes or previous events unrelated to the air strike.
Falters at times: The claim falters in terms of providing accurate and up-to-date information, as the satellite images used by Zee News were not actually recent and may be several years old.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the satellite images used were not updated daily and were not appropriate for comparison, as stated in the FAQ section of Zoom Earth.
Understate: There is no evident understatement bias in the provided claim.
